props.name: Parameter_Description_0
props.value: Prevent unprivileged processes from using the bpf() syscall.

props.name: Parameter_Description_1
props.value: Number of failed login attempts before account lockout

props.name: Parameter_Description_2
props.value: Interval for counting failed login attempts before account lockout

props.name: Parameter_Description_3
props.value: Seconds before automatic unlocking or permanently locking after excessive failed logins

props.name: Parameter_Description_5
props.value: Specify the authselect profile to select

props.name: Parameter_Description_6
props.value: Specify duration of allowed idle time.

props.name: Parameter_Description_7
props.value: Minimum number of digits in password

props.name: Parameter_Description_8
props.value: Minimum number of lower case in password

props.name: Parameter_Description_9
props.value: Minimum number of characters in password

props.name: Parameter_Description_10
props.value: Minimum number of other (special characters) in password

props.name: Parameter_Description_11
props.value: Minimum number of upper case in password

props.name: Parameter_Description_12
props.value: Specify the size component of the rekey limit.

props.name: Parameter_Description_13
props.value: Specify the size component of the rekey limit.

props.name: Parameter_Description_14
props.value:
Type of policy in use. Possible values are:
targeted - Only targeted network daemons are protected.
strict - Full SELinux protection.
mls - Multiple levels of security

props.name: Parameter_Description_15
props.value:
enforcing - SELinux security policy is enforced.
permissive - SELinux prints warnings instead of enforcing.
disabled - SELinux is fully disabled.

props.name: Parameter_Description_16
props.value: Specify the size component of the rekey limit. This limit signifies amount of data. After this amount of data is transferred through the connection, the session key is renegotiated. The number is followed by K, M or G for kilobytes, megabytes or gigabytes. Note that the RekeyLimit can be also configured according to elapsed time.

props.name: Parameter_Description_17
props.value: Specify the time component of the rekey limit. The session key is renegotiated after the defined amount of time passes. The number is followed by units such as H or M for hours or minutes. Note that the RekeyLimit can be also configured according to amount of transfered data.

props.name: Parameter_Description_18
props.value: Specify the crypto policy for the system.
